author: sky.cactus
content: <@219015859182632960> This whole *server* is not for governance talk, that includes <#595721451651465227>.  This channel is meant for discussing technical topics related to Ethereum that aren't covered by an existing channel.

author: yorickdowne
content: That means this discussion needs to shift entirely, <@!182614686720589824> . ethstaker discord #random is one possible place, appropriate topics are broader on that server.

author: whispernode
content:
Hey ETH devs!

Popping in to relay that Secret Network has announced a huge grant program for devs. We're really looking for some awesome devs to get involved in building programmable privacy-enabled applications in all sorts of areas; especially DeFi. The article has tons of examples:

https://scrt.network/blog/announcing-secret-network-grant-program

If anyone is interested in chatting I'd love to. You guys are all top notch in here. On telegram I am @BKBlockchain and I spend most of my time there ðŸ™‚ Otherwise you can also shoot me an email at Brendan@secret.foundation.

author: dkdkdkdkdkdk
content:
I might be confused, but my understanding is that withdrawals involve roughly two things
1. moving ETH from a validator to somewhere else
2. moving ETH from the beacon chain to eth1
it seems 1 would be enough to enable liquidity, but all discussion I've found is focused on 1+2. or does 1 not make sense without 2?
